abstract.para: Having a dictionary database fulfilling the requirements for inclusion into FreeDict, these are the steps to get your dictionary into FreeDict.

section.title: Naming of the dictionary files
section.para: For naming the TEI files we use the format la1-la2.tei, where la1 and la2 are ISO 639 3-letter language codes. You might also use the command info iso639 to get the list.

section.title: Importing into CVS
section.para: Ask a developer to import your TEI file (or the code to create the TEI file from a different format) into the FreeDict CVS repository. If you are a developer of FreeDict and have write access to the repository, you can import using a command like cvs import freedict/la1-la2 vendortag releasetag(?). At present vendortag and releasetag are not used, but it might be good to use them as intended by CVS: If you import files from some upstream project, use that project's name as vendortag and that project's release version as releasetag.
